content: The Object Class in Java is the root of class hierarchy. All classes inherit from the Object class; it is the superclass. When using other classes: String, Double, etc we are sometimes using methods of the Object class, such as equals() and toString()
name: Object

methods.name: equals
methods.content: The equals() method in the Object class compares the given object to the inputted object. The method returns true if the two objects are equal and false otherwise. Note: this method is often overridden.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"obj","type":"Object","required":true,"description":"the object being compared to the given object."}]

methods.name: toString
methods.content: The toString() method converts the specified object into a String and then returns it.
